item.title: Flytipping at end of allotment between st augustine's Rod and Ripley Road, 7th July
item.description:
Someone has dumped rocks, wood and a pile of dirt at the bottom of the allotments. It is blocking access to garages. It was dumped within last week. Please can this be removed. The allotment can be accessed by the entrance of Ripley Road by vehicle.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St Augustines Road, Lower Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 7th July
item.description:
Rubbish / furniture/ old carpet had been cleared out of garage into alleyway leading to the woods and Barnehurst green space. I moved the it all out of the way and placed it all in front of their garage. The next day I could see that they had thrown most of it over the fence and into the woods.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Holmsdale Grove, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Barriers dumped in front of office, 7th July
item.description:
Without consideration and on every occasion there is a festival barriers are dumped outside our office on the pavement and opposite the disabled parking and loading bays. No consideration for residents or business. Cant open office shutters

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Finsbury Park Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Infront of recycle bins, 7th July
item.description:
The largest mattress I've ever seen, bed frames, clothing and other items dumped Infront of the recycle bins, blocking access to all 3 bins. If this remains the bins will not be emptied this Wednesday.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kimberley Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fox was run over by a fast moving vehicle, 7th July
item.description:
I witnessed the fox being run over by a fast moving vehicle. The fox was then run over again. Truly distressing. Now it is in the middle of the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hurstwood Avenue, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bag of Building Waste Left On Overbury Avenue, 7th July
item.description:
Dear Bromley Council, I am writing to report a case of fly-tipping on Overbury avenue neaer 2E. A large bag containing what appears to be building or construction waste has been left on the pathway near property 2E. The bag has been left without any identification, and it is an eyesore as well as a potential hazard to pedestrians. It does not appear to be linked to any ongoing work in the area. Could you please arrange for the removal of this waste? Thank you for your assistance in keeping our borough clean!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Overbury Avenue, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet
